0.name: T in Dirt Road
desc: "   The road forms a 'T' here, continuing its way west to the Lotus
Blossom and branching off north towards the other side of town.  There
is a certain feeling of tranquility in the air, heightened by the soft
music of a flute somewhere nearby, floating along the breeze...

1.name: Dirt Road
desc: "   A quaint little path through a beautiful forest of light green.  You
can hear the birds singing in the breeze, and somewhere in the distance
you can hear the plucking medody of someone playing a koto.  There is a
small wooden sign along the side of the road, hand carved.  The path
continues west.
Welcome to Little Kyoto!
Be sure to visit our attractions, including
the Shinto Temple, the Lotus Blossom Bar,
and the Happy Samurai.  Have a good stay!

2.name: Outside the Lotus Blossom
desc: "   The second favorite hangout of the Shogun's men.  The Lotus Blossom
sits peacefully to the south here, where the road ends.  The building
is small and unobtrusive; not much sound emanates from within, and a
small curl of black smoke rises from the chimney.  The dirt road goes
back east.

extra.desc: Words could not describe the beauty.

3.name: Outside Brothel
desc: "   You stand outside the Happy Samurai, a favorite hangout of the Shogun's
men.  The low roof droops down invitingly over the entrance to the east.
Hmm...wonder if anyone's around...

4.name: The Lotus Blossom
desc: "   The most popular bar (and the only bar) in town.  The only place
where samurai and yakuza can sit in the same room and drink a hot
cup of sake.  Many a farmer with marital problems can be found here,
although most respectable people stay away.  Strange...not as many
people are here as you expected from the numbers going in...
There is an ornate teakwood door inconspicuously beckoning at the
back of the room on the west wall, and you can leave north.
"   This beautifully carved, ornate teakwood door sits inconspicuisly
at the back of the room on the west wall.  It is difficult to spot at
first; the way it is carved almost makes it seem to be a part of the
wall.

5.name: Back Room
desc: "   This is the "secret" opium den located in the back room of the
Lotus Blossom.  The dim lighting is worsened by the smoke; the air
is quite stuffy.  Patrons lie around on mats in inebriated pleasure,
sucking the deadly smoke that is their life's blood out of their
water pipes.
One of the mats has been moved aside, revealing an inviting
passage underneath...

6.name: Yakuza Den
desc: "   The secret underground hideout of the Japanese gangsters
known as the Yakuza.  Thieves scurry back and forth, some
carrying messages, some carrying money, some carrying drugs.
Many of them are missing fingers.
The practice yard is to the west, and a foreboding room
lies to the east...

7.name: Inner Sanctum
desc: "   The office of the Yakuza Master...head of organized crime
in Little Kyoto.  A strong sense of lust for money and power
pervades this place, adding to the atmosphere of violence.
Money and opium lie discarded carelessly all around the room,
and you can exit to the west.

8.name: Crossroads
desc: "   You stand at the crossroads in the middle of town.  You can travel west
towards Yamaguchi's Dojo and the Shogun's palace, or east towards the poorer
farm district.  The bar and brothel are both to the south, and you can travel
farther north into the Minakami Woods.

9.name: Foyer
desc: "   The foyer of the Happy Samurai, the local whorehouse.  Very tastefully
decorated, considering the business that is done here.  Paintings of cranes
and peacocks line the walls, adding to the warm, friendly atmosphere.  You
can take the stairway up to go deeper (?) into the building, or you can exit
to the west.  (There is a certain part of you screaming "GO UP! GO UP!!")

10.name: Hallway
desc: "   This is a quaint, well-kept hallway.  Not elegant, but...servicable.
There are two sliding paper screens here, to the north and south.  The
hall continues east, and you can go down the stairs to the foyer.  Was
that a giggle you just heard?...

11.name: Hallway
desc: "   The hallway ends here at another paper screen to the east, with two others
to your north and south.  You can travel west back down the hall, or maybe do
a little "exploring."
Did you just hear a moan?  Nah...

12.name: Matron Whore's Bedroom
desc: "   This room is different from the others, there is only one mat and one
pillow, and the light is dimmer.  Hope you didn't interrupt anything...

13.name: Outside Temple
desc: "   The most beautiful and majestic building in Little Kyoto, the Shinto
monastary, lies to the south.  You can hear the chants of the priests
counting beads emanating from within, an endless circle in search of the
ultimate meaninglessness of life and death.  You can enter to the south,
or you can continue along your way to the east and west.

14.name: Outside Dojo
desc: "  You stand just outside the dojo of Yamaguchi Sensei, the greatest karate
teacher in Little Kyoto.  There must be a class in progress; the building
shakes with the stomping of feet and the air is filled with the distant sounds
of the students kiai.  The road continues west a short way and ends at the
Shogun's Palace, or you can travel back east.

15.name: Farm District
desc: "   The poorer section of Little Kyoto, where all the real production takes
place.  Fields of rice stretch out towards the mountains to the east, a
tribute to plenty.  The farmer would obviously be well off if he wasn't so
heavily taxed by the Shogun.  The farmer's house lies directly to the north,
and the rice mill to the immediate east.  You can travel back west to the
crossroads.

16.name: Bedroom
desc: "   You have entered one of the chambers where the geishas wait for their
customers.  There are several mats and pillows lying around, and you can
hear giggles and moans emanating from all around you.  The only exit is
back through the paper screen.

17.name: Bedroom
desc: "   You have entered one of the chambers where the geishas wait for their
customers.  There are several mats and pillows lying around, and you can
hear giggles and moans emanating from all around you.  The only exit is
back through the paper screen.

18.name: Bedroom
desc: "   You have entered one of the chambers where the geishas wait for their
customers.  There are several mats and pillows lying around, and you can
hear giggles and moans emanating from all around you.  The only exit is
back through the paper screen.

19.name: Bedroom
desc: "   You have entered one of the chambers where the geishas wait for their
customers.  There are several mats and pillows lying around, and you can
hear giggles and moans emanating from all around you.  The only exit is
back through the paper screen.

20.name: Third Chamber
desc: "   The third chamber of the dojo, where lower ranking black belts can usually
be found instructing the latest wave of white belts.  A cool breeze flows in
from several open screens, keeping the air fresh.  The hardwood floor is clean
and smooth, and several charts of beginning kata are on the walls.  You can
leave the dojo to the south, or go north into the second chamber.
The crane katas of the Saifa series are beautifully illustrated for those who
wish to further their training.

21.name: Second Chamber
desc: "   The second chamber of the dojo, where Yamaguchi sensei himself can be found
guiding the further instruction of his black belt students.  A portrait of
Miyagi Sensei is on the wall above several makiwara striking boards.  There is
a screen to the north, beatifully painted with the image of a tiger preparing
to pounce...
The screen must lead to another room to the north, although it is closed
right now.  The tiger is very realistically painted, its hungry eyes stare
into you soul...

extra.desc: A solemn portrait of Sensei Chojun Miyagi, founder of Goju-Ryu karate.

22.name: First Chamber
desc: "   You have breached the sanctity of the first chamber, a training place
reserved only for the inner circles of the higher ranking black belts.  You
can attempt to escape to the south.

23.name: Rice Mill
desc: "   This is the rice mill, where all the rice grinding is done.  Rice lies all
around you in abundance, a sure sign that milling has taken place recently.
You can exit west.

24.name: Farmhouse
desc: "   You are inside the farmhouse, where the rice farmer resides with his wife
and children.  The surroundings are rather simple, but clean and well-cared
after.  You can exit to the south.

25.name: Practice Yard
desc: "   The training yard of Japanese thieves.  Some of the younger Yakuza
are practicing their skills here, honing their abilities to backstab,
pick locks, steal, and so on.  You notice that most of them still have
all of their fingers.  There is a passage leading back to the den to the
east.

26.name: Forest Path
desc: "   A quaint little path through a beautiful forest of light green.  You
can hear the birds singing in the breeze, and somewhere in the distance
you hear the sound of rushing water.  The path continues north into the
Minakami Woods and south to Little Kyoto.

27.name: Front Gate
desc: "   You stand just outside the palace of the Shogun, the ruler of Little
Kyoto.  You can hear the sounds of the samurai in training in the courtyard
beyond the front gate, they sound pretty tough.  You can go east down the
dirt road and re-enter town, or you can brave the palace...
"   The gate is black metal, and guards the way into the courtyard beyond,
where you can see the samurai practicing their fighting skills.

28.name: Courtyard
desc: "   You stand in the courtyard of the Shogun's palace, where his men can
often be found practicing their swordfighting and their aikido.  You can
leave the palace to the east, or you can continue west into the garden.

29.name: Garden
desc: "   You are in a quaint herb garden used to grow the herbs that season the
Shogun's food.  You go east to the training courtyard, or you can enter the
residential area of the palace to the west.

30.name: Anteroom
desc: "   This is the anteroom of the palace, and is beautifully and richly
decorated with different paintings and carvings from all over the realms.
You can go to the garden to the east, the throne room to the north, and
the sleeping chamber to the south.

31.name: Throne Room
desc: "   This is the throne room of the Shogun, where he rules this town and
its inhabitants.  You are awed by the grandeur of this room, but you hold
back your respect-this was all paid for out of the taxes of the over-
burdened residents of Little Kyoto.  You can exit south.

32.name: Bedroom
desc: "   You are in the private sleeping chamber of the Shogun, where all of
his illegitimate children are conceived.  You can exit to the north.

33.name: Dirt Road
desc: "   You are nearing the end of the dirt road, the front gate of the Shogun's
palace lies before you.  You can go west or back east towards the rest of
town.

34.name: Denser Forest
desc: "   The forest is very dense along the path here, and doesn't allow
passage to the east or west.  It grows lighter to the north, however,
where it intercepts a clearing, and you can follow the path south
towards the town of Little Kyoto.

35.name: Clearing
desc: "   A quaint little forest clearing where you could stop for a bit and
enjoy your surroundings.  You can see some forest animals playing in a
beautiful meadow just to the north, and a path leads east towards the
sound of rushing water.  The forest grows denser to the south.

36.name: Minakami Path
desc: "   The trees that line the path on either side arch up towards each
other, and far above your head their branches intermingle and criss-
cross tentatively like young lovers.  The path leads toward a dark
area to the east, and back west to the main trail.  Somewhere in the
distance you hear the roar of a tiger.

37.name: Dim Path
desc: "  The trees are very dense around you here, only allowing passage to
the west and north.  You hear the distant chattering of monkeys, and
the sound of rushing water is noticeably louder.

38.name: Rocky Path
desc: "   You have reached the edge of the forest, where the path grows quite
rocky and more difficult to navigate.  You can enter the forest to the
south, or you can go east, where you see a beautiful waterfall.

39.name: Waterfall
desc: "   The path comes to an end here at a beautiful waterfall shrouded in green.
The four-foot-wide sheet of water flows gracefully from a ledge hanging eight
feet or so above the pool of radiance below.  You realize that what really
catches your eye about the waterfall is its symmetry, it almost looks too
perfect.
The dimensions of the waterfall are perfect and square, and it is
exceptionally thin.  It seems exactly placed over an indent in the
stone wall behind it.
The door is black stone, and is very well placed.  It blends in perfectly
with the stone wall behind it.

40.name: Minakami Forest
desc: "  You stand at the edge of the forest, just west of the meadow.  All
around, you hear the sounds of the forest; the screeching of monkeys,
the mournful call of a crane, and somewhere farther off the distant
roar of a tiger.

41.name: Meadow
desc: "   A beautiful meadow in the center of the forest.  Cranes and small
animals wander freely through the tall grass, enjoying the simple
pleasures in life.  The Minakami Woods surrounds you on all directions
except south, which leads back to the forest clearing.

42.name: Minakami Forest
desc: "   You wander through the fresh air and simple beauty of the Minakami
Woods.  Paths lead off in most directions, and somewhere in the
distance you can hear the rushing sound of a waterfall.

43.name: Minakami Forest
desc: "   You wander through the fresh air and simple beauty of the Minakami
Woods.  Paths lead off in most directions, and somewhere in the
distance you can hear the sound of rushing water.

44.name: Minakami Forest
desc: "   You stand at the edge of the forest, just north of the meadow.
Somewhere nearby you hear the call of a crane searching for its mate,
and further yet, the sounds of rushing water.  You can go in any
direction.

45.name: Minakami Forest
desc: "   You stand in the simple splendor of the Minakami Woods, amidst the
small pine trees and the occasional sounds of birdcries.  Paths
continue to the north, east, and south.

46.name: Minakami Forest
desc: "   You stand deep in the Minakami Woods, the trees are too dense to the
north to make any more progress.  All around, you hear the sounds of
forest, and somewhere nearby you can hear the screeching of a monkey.

47.name: Minakami Forest
desc: "   You are deep in the Minakami woods, the trees are too dense to the
north to make any more progress.  All around you hear the sounds of
the forest, and somewhere nearby you can hear the chattering of a
monkey.

48.name: Minakami Forest
desc: "   You wander through the fresh air and simple beauty of the Minakami
Woods.  Paths lead off in most directions, and somewhere in the
distance you can hear the rushing sound of a waterfall.

49.name: Behind the Waterfall
desc: "   You stand just behind the waterfall, and see the area beyond through its
distorted lens.  The rushing sound of water is amplified here, and echoes
back into the dark cave to the north.

50.name: Wet Cave
desc: "   The cave is much more damp here, lichen and moss grow in abundance.  Some
glow dimly, adding to the eerie atmosphere and helping illuminate the tunnel
beyond.  You can't shake the feeling that you are being watched...

51.name: Tunnel
desc: "   The tunnel grows slightly narrower here, a claustrophobic feeling washes
over you like nausea. The rushing sound of the waterfall is very muffled, the
distance has turned its roar into a faint disturbance. The tunnel continues
north and south.

52.name: Tunnel
desc: "  You have reached the end of the tunnel.  The sound of the waterfall has
been reduced to a whisper, and the lichens grow more sparsely.  There is a
small passage near to the ground leading east, and a strange, beckoning
passage leading west.  You can follow the tunnel back south.

53.name: Small Passage
desc: "   You are in a small passage in the side of the tunnel.  The passage ends
as quickly as it began however, you can't go any further.  There is a hole
about ten feet above you, but you don't think you can reach it.  Your only
exit is to the west.
You can't see anything beyond, it is too dark on the other side of the hole.
It is too far up for you to reach.

54.name: Entrance to the Eternal Passageway
desc: "   You stand at the entrance to the Eternal Passageway, a seemingly endless
myriad of rooms with twisting corridors that lead off in every direction.
This place is forbidden to the townsfolk, legend has it that the ninja live
in secrecy here and navigate the passage with confidence.  There is a sign
here.  You can leave east, or you can brave the passage and enter to the
north.

55.name: Eternal Passageway
desc: "   This is one of the many rooms in the Eternal Passageway, twisting tunnels
lead off in every direction.

56.name: Eternal Passageway
desc: "   This is one of the many rooms in the Eternal Passageway, twisting tunnels
lead off in every direction.

57.name: Eternal Passageway
desc: "   This is one of the many rooms in the Eternal Passageway, twisting tunnels
lead off in every direction.

58.name: Eternal Passageway
desc: "   This is one of the many rooms in the Eternal Passageway, twisting tunnels
lead off in every direction.

59.name: Walkway
desc: "   You stand in a straight, normal walkway; the twisting passages of the
Eternal Passageway left behind.  There is no moss or lichen here, and the
tunnel seems much more defined, more man-made.  You can continue down the
hallway eastward or you can re-enter the maze to the west.

60.name: Walkway
desc: "   You stand in a walkway opposite from the Eternal Passageway, which lies
a little ways to the west.  You can continue towards a round room to the east,
where you think you hear some voices in attentive conversation.

61.name: Round Room
desc: "   You are in the ante-chamber to the secret ninja lair, where the masters
of the art of invisibility make their abode and practice their deadly skills.
You can enter the initial training hall directly to the south, and you can re-
enter the walkway to the west.

62.name: Ninja Training Hall
desc: "   You've found the ninja training hall, where the ninja go to hone their
skills and practice their deadly art.  You have an eerie feeling that you
are being watched, and would feel safer going back north.  There are two
hallways to the east and west.

63.name: Ninja Hallway
desc: "   This hallway leads down from the training hall to the first chunin chamber,
the rooms of the lower-ranking ninja line it on both sides.  You can continue
south down the hall, enter a sleeping chamber to the west, or go back east to
the training hall.  There is also a small hole going down to a room about ten
feet below...but you don't think you could make it back up.
This hole allows you to drop down into a room about ten feet below, but you
don't think you could make it back up.

64.name: Sentry's Chamber
desc: "   This is the sleeping chamber of a genin ninja, the lowest ranking ninja.
It is bare, save for the essentials, and you can exit west.

65.name: Ninja Hallway
desc: "   You are now halfway down the hallway, and realize you are haunted by the
feeling that you are being watched.  This place gives you the creeps...
You can continue down the hall to the north or south, or you can enter a
sleeping chamber to the east.

66.name: Sentry's Chamber
desc: "   This is the sleeping chamber of a genin ninja, the lowest ranking ninja.
It is bare, save for the essentials, and you can exit west.

67.name: Ninja Hallway
desc: "   You stand just outside of the chunin's chamber to the south and the
kunoichi's chamber to the east.  You feel compelled to go north back up
the hallway; this place gives you the willies.

68.name: Kunoichi's Chamber
desc: "   This is the sleeping chamber of a kunoichi, a female ninja.  Various
feminine things are here.  You can exit west.

69.name: Chunin's Chamber
desc: "   This is the sleeping chamber of a chunin, a higher ranking ninja.  The
room is bare, save for the essentials, but you can't shake the feeling that
you are being watched...

70.name: Ninja Hallway
desc: "   This hallway leads down from the training hall to the Shinobi's chamber,
where the rooms of the higher-ranking ninja are found.  You can continue
down the hallway or you can enter a sleeping chamber to the east.

71.name: Kunoichi's Chamber
desc: "   You've entered that living space of a Kunoichi, female ninja.  Various
feminine things lie around the room.  You can exit west.

72.name: Chunin's Chamber
desc: "   The living quarters of the chunin, a higher ranking ninja.  It is bare,
save for the essentials, but you can't help but feel watched...
You can exit east.

73.name: Ninja Hallway
desc: "   You can almost feel the hairs prick up on the back of your neck...you
have an unshakable feeling that you are being watched.  You can follow the
hallway north and south, and you can enter a chamber to the west.

74.name: Ninja Hallway
desc: "   You begin to feel severe apprehension as you draw nearer to the Shinobi's
chamber, and begin to wonder if it's already to late to turn back...
You can continue north or south, and you can enter a sleeping chamber to the
east.

75.name: Chunin's Chamber
desc: "   The living quarters of the chunin, a higher ranking ninja.  It is bare,
save for the essentials, but you can't help but feel watched...
You can exit west.

76.name: Chunin's Chamber
desc: "   The living quarters of the chunin, a higher ranking ninja.  It is bare,
save for the essentials, but you can't help but feel watched...
You can exit east.

77.name: Outside Shinobi's Chamber
desc: "   You stand just outside the Shinobi's chamber, marveling that you are still
alive.  You just KNOW that you are being watched, and you feel as if you've
just willingly walked into an ambush.  You can go north up the hallway, west
into another sleeping chamber, or south into the clutches of the Shinobi.

78.name: Shinobi's Chamber
desc: "   You are in the living quarters of the leader of the ninja-the Shinobi.
Various poisons and fighting implements lay about the room, and a mysterious
exit leads south.  You can go back to the hallway to the north.

79.name: Treasure Storage
desc: "   The room where the ninja store their gold, the profit of years of
assassination and thievery from the town of Little Kyoto.  The ill-gotten
wealth of the masters of invisibility lies all around you, carelessly tossed
here and then forgotten.  You can exit north.

80.name: Entrance to Monastary
desc: "   You stand just inside the doorway of Little Kyoto's Shinto monastary,
the only stone structure in town.  You can't help but to stop for a
moment and admire the architecture; there is a simple beauty in the long
green moss that hangs from the pillars.  It seems so peaceful here.
You can continue south into the temple or you can go north to the dirt
road.

81.name: Junction
desc: "   You have come to a junction of hallways, south to the main hall, east to
the priest's chambers, west to the prayer courtyard, and north to leave the
temple.

82.name: Meditation Hall
desc: "   The meditation hall of the priests.  They come here when they gather
together for ceremonies and when they meet with the citizens of the town.
There are rows of mats here for them to kneel on, facing the shrine at the
end of the room.  The only light here streams in from the front entrance,
there are no windows.  You can exit to the north, and the shrine is south.

83.name: Shrine
desc: "   The shrine of the temple, the place where they burn their incense and
pray for guidance.  The natural lighting has grown dim here, and the melted
wax on the altar seems to indicate that candles are often burned here with
the incense for priests who meditate in the evening.  There is a statuette
of their deity on the altar from which emanates a certain cynical wisdom.
You can exit to the north.
This is a statuette of a tall, well built demon-spawn humanoid with pitch
black skin.  Its body is hairless and perfect, and its vacant eyes stare
menacingly into your soul...

84.name: Hall
desc: "   This hallway is dark and gloomy, a hollow reflection of the lives of the
priests whose chambers line it.  These rooms are where they spend most of
their time when they aren't deep in ceremony or meditation.  You can enter
a chamber to the east or you can follow the hall to the south.

85.name: Priest's Chamber
desc: "   What a dreary life must be that of a priest-the bare walls, the cold stone,
the heartless room that offers no comfort.  Such a state of self-denial seems
to lead to de-humanization.  You find yourself growing depressed, and you want
to exit west.

86.name: Hall
desc: "   You are about halfway down the dark hall, and a spirit of gloom is upon
you.  You can continue along the hall to the north and south, and you can
enter a priest's chamber to the east.  You get the distinct impression that
this place could wilt flowers at will.

87.name: Priest's Chamber
desc: "   This room is the same as the others...cold and depressing.  You wonder
how someone could live a life so bare.  You feel compelled to exit west.

88.name: Hall
desc: "   You have reached the end of the hall, where you can continue south into
the counting room.  The last priest's chamber lies to the east, and you can
follow the hallway back north.  This place fills you with such depression...

89.name: Priest's Chamber
desc: "   Another priest's chamber...the same bare room and cold floor.  How can
they stand to live like this?  You can exit to the west.

90.name: Counting Room
desc: "   The room where certain disillusioned priests can go to count their beads
and regain their lost faith.  Sometimes certain priests preparing for sexual
encounters sit here and count them over and over thousands of times for a
month before they feel purified and ready to procreate.

91.name: Hall
desc: "   The lighting is good here, the hall comes from the courtyard located at
the side of the temple.  You can hear the chants of the priests in the
courtyard as they pray for higher enlightenment.  You can continue west, or
you can go east to the junction.

92.name: Courtyard
desc: "   You stand in the shinto courtyard, where a few stunted trees grow among
the rocks and the birds are never found.  You hear the endless chant of the
priests, trying forever to redeem themselves from life and become their
ultimate aspiration...one with nothing.  You can enter a small storage house
to the south or travel back east into the temple.

93.name: Storage Room
desc: "   This is a small room adjacent to the courtyard which the priests have
converted into a storage area.  Different garden tools are neatly stacked
here off to the side, and it appears that this area recieves traffic often.
There is a hole in the floor here, and you can go back north to the courtyard.
The hole in the floor is perfectly circular and is about
two feet in diameter.  You can see a ladder inside going
down.

94.name: Room of Jars
desc: "   You find yourself in the burial chamber of the Shinto priests.  The
walls are lined with ceremonial jars, each one filled with the ashes of
those who have gone on in their search for enlightenment.  The passage
to the north seems less traveled, leading farther away from the ladder
that takes you back to the land of the living...

95.name: Tombs
desc: "   This rooms seems older, and the jars have been replaced with tombs.
The air has grown very musty, heightening you already quickened sense
of apprehension.  An ominous sense of hatred seems to emanate from the
room to the east, you have a sudden urge to flee south to the safety of
the light.  There is some graffiti scrawled on the wall here.
Wise man once say "Man who rushes blindly into danger with no recall
scroll and no graph paper is a fool.

96.name: Hatred
desc: "   As you enter this room you instantly feel fear; constant, throbbing,
growing.  You inexplicably feel like you are being watched by somone
who you can't see...someone who hates you.  Someone who, for no reason,
wishes to kill you.  You can't shake the feeling, it's like you just
woke up from a bad dream and you're still there.  You can escape in any
direction.

97.name: Catacombs
desc: "   You wander through a large maze of tombs found deep under the temple;
the confusing passages seem to meander on forever.  Jars of ashes and
burial crypts line the walls, and strange noises echo in the darkness
beyond.  Passages lead away in all directions.

98.name: Catacombs
desc: "   You wander through a large maze of tombs found deep under the temple;
the confusing passages seem to meander on forever.  Jars of ashes and
burial crypts line the walls, and strange noises echo in the darkness
beyond.  Passages lead away in all directions.

99.name: Catacombs
desc: "   You wander through a large maze of tombs found deep under the temple;
the confusing passages seem to meander on forever.  Jars of ashes and
burial crypts line the walls, and strange noises echo in the darkness
beyond.  Passages lead away in all directions.

100.name: Catacombs
desc: "   You wander through a large maze of tombs found deep under the temple;
the confusing passages seem to meander on forever.  Jars of ashes and
burial crypts line the walls, and strange noises echo in the darkness
beyond.  Passages lead away in all directions.

101.name: Catacombs
desc: "   You wander through a large maze of tombs found deep under the temple;
the confusing passages seem to meander on forever.  Jars of ashes and
burial crypts line the walls, and strange noises echo in the darkness
beyond.  Passages lead away in all directions.

102.name: West of Gloominess
desc: "   You can't quite put your finger on what it is, but for some reason you
begin to feel mildly depressed.  You can exit east and south.

103.name: Gloominess
desc: "   As you enter this room you are filled with a deep sense of depression.
You consider turning back, but decide that maybe it isn't worth it.
Maybe nothing is worth anything anymore and you should just end it all
right now before you get even more depressed.  You can exit in every
direction, but you don't see why you should try.

104.name: Catacombs
desc: "   You wander through a large maze of tombs found deep under the temple;
the confusing passages seem to meander on forever.  Jars of ashes and
burial crypts line the walls, and strange noises echo in the darkness
beyond.  Passages lead away in all directions.

105.name: Corner
desc: "   You have come to a corner in the maze, a nice place to rest and
try to shake off the feeling that you are just walking in circles.
You can re-enter the passages of the catacombs to the north and to
the west.

106.name: Hall of Skulls
desc: "   You have stumbled upon the entrance to the Hall of Skulls, a section
of the labyrinth built entirely out of decaying human heads.  The white
faces grin dryly at you out of the darkness, their empty eyes stare right
through your soul.  You can re-enter the catacombs to the west, or you can
continue east down the eerie corridor.

107.name: Hall of Skulls
desc: "   You are halfway down the corridor now, you can see both ends faintly
through the darkness.  You begin to experience a sensation that you are
being watched, and wonder if maybe you shouldn't turn back...

108.name: Hall of Skulls
desc: "   You have reached the end of the hall, where the walls of skulls finally
come to an end.  You can take a passage south, or you can go back west.

109.name: Outside Tomb
desc: "   You are outside what appears to be a large tomb, sealed with a great
stone door.  There is an epitaph written on the wall here in glowing
golden letters, as though scrawled with magic fire.  You can go north
back into the hall of skulls.
"          The Tomb of the Fallen God
This is the tomb of the immortal Qornak. Legend has
it that he once lived in Asgaard with the gods, and
fell shamefully from grace after he was discovered
interfering with the destinies of mortals, a trans-
gression strictly forbidden to the deities.

110.name: Qornak's Tomb
desc: "   You stand in a tomb of darkness and isolation, Qornak's private hell.
The room emanates a deep sense of loss and regret, and surges with an
intense emotion of anger and retribution.  You had better leave...

111.name: Catacombs
desc: "   You wander through a large maze of tombs found deep under the temple;
the confusing passages seem to meander on forever.  Jars of ashes and
burial crypts line the walls, and strange noises echo in the darkness
beyond.  Passages lead away in all directions.

112.name: Catacombs
desc: "   You wander through a large maze of tombs found deep under the temple;
the confusing passages seem to meander on forever.  Jars of ashes and
burial crypts line the walls, and strange noises echo in the darkness
beyond.  Passages lead away in all directions.

113.name: Dead End
desc: "   You have stumbled upon one of the few dead ends in the labyrinth,
a good place for the smart adventurer to stop and get his bearings.
It is darker here, but at least you know that there is nothing behind
you except the wall.  There is an inscription scrawled here.
The inscription is written in an excited hand...
S E E S S S

114.name: Hall of Bones
desc: "   You have stumbled upon the entrance to the Hall of Bones, a section
of the labyrinth built entirely out of decaying human bodies.  The white
fingers seem to emanate from the walls and point right through you.  You
can re-enter the catacombs to the east, or you can continue west down the
eerie corridor.

115.name: Hall of Bones
desc: "   You are halfway down the corridor now, you can see both ends faintly
through the darkness.  You begin to experience a sensation that you are
being watched, and wonder if maybe you shouldn't turn back...

116.name: Hall of Bones
desc: "   You have reached the end of the hall, where the walls of bones finally
come to and end.  You can take a passage north, or you can go back east.

117.name: Outside Lair
desc: "   You are outside what appears to be a large tomb, sealed with a great
stone door.  There is an engraving on the wall here in golden letters,
as though written with magic fire.  You can go south back into the hall
of bones.
Remove thy shoes, pilgrim, for
you stand on holy ground.  Woe
be to him that dare to disturb
the resting place of Sadus the
lord of the thieves; ye hath
incurred the wrath of the gods!

118.name: Catacombs
desc: "   You wander through a large maze of tombs found deep under the temple;
the confusing passages seem to meander on forever.  Jars of ashes and
burial crypts line the walls, and strange noises echo in the darkness
beyond.  Passages lead away in all directions.

desc: "   You wander through a large maze of tombs found deep under the temple;

125.name: Room of Peace
desc: "   As you enter this room a peaceful wave of calmness washes over you.
It seems much more friendly, an oasis in the heart of the confusing
passages of the dead.  It seems like a pleasant place to stop and find
your bearings.  You can re-enter the maze in any direction.

126.name: Catacombs
desc: "   You wander through a large maze of tombs found deep under the temple;
the confusing passages seem to meander on forever.  Jars of ashes and
burial crypts line the walls, and strange noises echo in the darkness

133.name: Dead End
desc: "   You have stumbled upon one of the few dead ends in the labyrinth,
a good place for the smart adventurer to stop and get his bearings.
It is darker here, but at least you know that there is nothing behind

The inscription is written in the hand of one who has lost all hope...
N E E E
